byline.original: By ANNISSA HAMBOUZ and YASMIN CHIN EISENHAUER

docs.abstract: In this lesson, students learn about Nobel Prize winning economist Thomas C. Schelling's "strategic egonomics" theory as it applies to making New Year's resolutions. They then make their own resolutions and develop plans to keep them using Schelling's strategies.
docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
